news.headline: Snap Inc. reported Q4 2024 revenue growth with active advertisers doubling. CEO Evan Spiegel shared progress on community engagement and AR vision.
news.summary: Snap Inc. released its financial results for the quarter and full year concluding on December 31, 2024. The company, trading under the symbol SNAP on the NYSE, shared its achievements in enhancing user engagement and expanding its community. Evan Spiegel, the CEO, highlighted the growth in active advertisers during Q4, which more than doubled. He emphasized the company's efforts in driving revenue growth and diversifying income streams to align with their augmented reality vision.

news.headline: Private equity firm BV Investment Partners sells TopBloc to ASGN Incorporated, a tech-enabled business services company.
news.summary: Today, BV Investment Partners (BV), a private equity firm specializing in tech-enabled business services, software, and IT services sectors, revealed the signing of a definitive agreement for the sale of TopBloc. TopBloc, a rapidly growing company, is a key player in the industry.

news.headline: Buenaventura issues US$650 million senior unsecured notes due 2032 with interest rate of 6.8%.
news.summary: In Lima, Peru, the leading publicly-traded precious metals mining company, Compañia de Minas Buenaventura S.A.A. (NYSE: BVN; Lima Stock Exchange: BUE.LM), has confirmed the completion of a profitable issuance of senior unsecured notes valued at $650 million with a maturity date set for February 4, 2032. These Notes carry an annual interest rate of 6.800% and were exclusively offered through a private placement to qualified inst...

news.headline: Rockford Fosgate unveils M2 Element Ready™ Subwoofers, promising deep bass and stellar performance.
news.summary: In Tempe, Arizona on February 4, 2025, Rockford Fosgate, known for high-performance audio systems, has unveiled its latest product - the M2 Element Ready™ Subwoofers. These subwoofers promise exceptional reliability and deliver deep, powerful bass with heightened responsiveness. The new release signals Rockford Fosgate's commitment to innovation and quality in the audio industry. More information can be found on their website at www.rockfordfosgate.com.

news.headline: Envista Holdings Corp to hold Capital Markets Day on March 5, 2025 from 9:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. EST.
news.summary: Envista Holdings Corporation (NYSE: NVST) based in BREA, Calif., has scheduled a Capital Markets Day for Wednesday, March 5, 2025, from 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. EST. During this event, there will be a management presentation and subsequent discussions.

news.headline: Mondelēz posts positive Q4 and FY 2024 figures.
AZEK Company's Q1 2025 results show increased net sales and EBITDA outlook; CEO satisfied with growth.
news.summary: In Chicago, The AZEK Company Inc. (NYSE: AZEK), a top manufacturer of eco-friendly outdoor products like TimberTech® Decking, Versatex®, and StruXure® pergolas, released its fiscal Q1 results for the period ending December 31, 2024. The CEO expressed satisfaction with the quarter, highlighting significant growth driven by strategic efforts and efficient operations.

news.headline: The Hanover Insurance Group reported Q4 net income of $167.9M ($4.59/diluted share) & full year net income of $426M ($11.70/diluted share). Operating income was $194.6M ($5.32/diluted share) in Q4 & $485.9M ($13.34/diluted share) for the year. They experienced a record net written premium of $6.1B in 2024, an increase of 4.7%. The combined ratio was 89.2% in Q4 & 94.8% for the year, excluding catastrophes, it was 87.5% in Q4 & 88.4% for the year. Net premiums written increased by 7.4% in Q4. Personal Lines had the highest operating income before taxes at $101.1M in Q4. The expense ratio increased to 26.2% in the Q4. They also marked 20 years of annual dividend increases. Net investment income was $372.6M for the year, seeing positive growth.
news.summary: The Hanover Insurance Group, Inc. reported strong financial performance in the fourth quarter of 2024, with a net income of $167.9 million compared to $107.9 million in the prior year. The fourth quarter also saw a combined ratio of 89.2%, net premiums written increase of 7.4%, and renewal price increases averaging at 14.2% in Personal Lines, 11.8% in Core Commercial, and 9.5% in Specialty. The full year 2024 showed a net income of $426.0 million, an increase from $35.3 million in the prior year, with a combined ratio of 94.8% and net premiums written of $6.1 billion, reflecting growth in all segments. The company's full-year operating income was $485.9 million, with an ambitious strategic plan for 2025 focusing on growth initiatives and optimizing market opportunities. The investment income was up 23.4% from the prior year, driven by higher bond reinvestment rates and cashflows. The Hanover also increased its shareholder dividend by 5.9% in December 2024, showing a commitment to creating shareholder value.

news.headline: Carlisle Companies Inc. (NYSE: CSL) reports Q4 2024 results with $1.1 billion revenue, $18.34 diluted EPS for the year, $3.56 for the quarter, a 30% YoY increase in adjusted EPS to $20.20, and operating margin of 19.9%. Acquisition of Plasti-Fab completed.
news.summary: Carlisle Companies Incorporated (NYSE:CSL) reported its financial results for the fourth quarter of 2024. The company achieved a record full-year diluted EPS of $18.34 and adjusted EPS of $20.20, representing a 30% year-over-year increase. In the fourth quarter, revenue reached $1.1 billion, marking a slight 0.4% decrease year-over-year. Diluted EPS for the quarter was reported at $3.56 while adjusted EPS hit a record high of $4.47, up by 7% compared to the previous year. The operating margin stood at 19.9%, with an adjusted EBITDA margin of 25.1%. Additionally, Carlisle Companies Incorporated successfully completed the acquisition of Plasti-Fab, a Canadian-based manufacturer.

news.headline: Zurn Elkay Water Solutions releases financial results for Q4 and full year 2024 in Milwaukee.
news.summary: Milwaukee-based company, Zurn Elkay Water Solutions, recently announced their financial results for the fourth quarter and full year of 2024. They reported strong numbers, with revenues for the year reaching $X million, reflecting a Y% increase from the previous year. The fourth quarter alone saw revenues of $A million, showcasing steady growth in their business. Zurn Elkay Water Solutions continues to demonstrate their financial stability and positive performance in the market.

news.headline: Chipotle's Q4 2024 saw a 5.4% rise in sales, totaling $2.8B, with a 14.6% increase for full year at $11.3B. Net income for Q4 was $331.8M ($0.24 per share) and $1.53B for the year ($1.11 per share), with a goal to open 315-345 restaurants in 2025. Labor costs were at 25.2% of total revenue in Q4, with $191.2M in administrative expenses and a tax rate of 24.4%. Adjusted net income was $340M in Q4 and $1.54B for the year. Chipotle has a forward-looking goal of achieving 7,000 restaurants in North America.
news.summary: Chipotle Mexican Grill reported strong financial results, with a 5.4% increase in fourth-quarter comparable sales driven by a 4.0% transaction growth. Full-year 2024 saw comparable sales increase by 7.4% with a 5.3% transaction growth. Total revenue for the fourth quarter was $2.8 billion, a 13.1% increase, while for the full year it was $11.3 billion, a 14.6% increase. Net income for the fourth quarter was $331.8 million, or $0.24 per diluted share, and for the full year, it was $1.53 billion, or $1.11 per diluted share. Chipotle opened 304 company-owned restaurants in 2024 and aimed to open 315 to 345 in 2025. Labor costs were 25.2% of total revenue in Q4 and 24.7% for the full year. General and administrative expenses were $191.2 million in Q4 and $697.5 million for the full year. Chipotle plans to continue focusing on growth, with an outlook of low to mid-single digit comparable sales growth, new restaurant openings, and an estimated effective full-year tax rate of 25% to 27% for 2025.

news.headline: Champion Homes reports Q3 fiscal 2025 results: Net sales up 15.3% to $644.9M, homes sold up 14.1% to 6,437, backlog at $313M.
news.summary: In Troy, Michigan, Champion Homes, Inc. (NYSE: SKY) shared its financial results for the third quarter ending on December 28, 2024. In the third quarter of fiscal 2025, several key highlights were noted in comparison to the same quarter in fiscal 2024. Net sales saw a notable increase of 15.3%, reaching $644.9 million. The number of U.S. homes sold also rose by 14.1% to a total of 6,437 units. The company's backlog showed growth as well, with a 7.6% increase from December 2023; however, it decreased by 26.9% to $313 million from the previous sequential quarter. The Average Selling Price (ASP) per unit was not specifically mentioned in the summarized report.

news.headline: Mueller Water Products saw a strong start in Q1 2025: Net Sales rose by 18.7% to $304.3M, Net Income per Diluted Share was $0.22, and Adjusted EBITDA improved by 41.7% to $63.5M. Annual guidance raised for Net Sales and Adjusted EBITDA. Operating income surged to $47.4M, and Adjusted EBITDA saw a large margin gain. Q1 results led to increased net income and a forecast of continued gains in fiscal 2025. The company invested $11.9M in capital expenditures during Q1. Stakeholders optimistic about strong financial performance and strategic initiatives moving forward.
news.summary: Mueller Water Products, Inc. reported strong financial results for fiscal 2025 first quarter, with net sales increasing by 18.7% to $304.3 million compared to the prior year quarter. Operating income rose to $47.4 million from $22.8 million in the previous year, and adjusted operating income increased by 78.2% to $52.4 million. Net income per diluted share was $0.22, with adjusted net income per diluted share at $0.25. Adjusted EBITDA also saw a significant increase of 41.7% to $63.5 million. The company raised its annual guidance for fiscal 2025 net sales and adjusted EBITDA. As of December 31, 2024, Mueller Water Products had $449.5 million in total debt and $338.2 million in cash and cash equivalents. The company's fiscal 2025 outlook includes expectations for consolidated net sales to be between $1,370 million and $1,390 million and adjusted EBITDA between $310 million and $315 million. The company's segment results for Water Flow Solutions and Water Management Solutions also showed positive growth.

news.headline: Western Union reports Q4 2024 revenue of $1.1 billion, up 1% driven by Consumer Services and Branded Digital growth.
news.summary: In Denver, the Western Union Company (NYSE: WU) released its financial results for Q4 and full year 2024. The company reported a fourth-quarter revenue of $1.1 billion, marking a 1% increase. This growth was primarily fueled by advancements in Consumer Services and Branded Digital segments. Notably, revenue was slightly affected by reduced contributions from Iraq, resulting in a 3-percentage point decline in revenue growth rate. The company highlighted its commitment to continued growth and innovation in its services.

(NASDAQ: AZPN), a prominent industrial software company, based in Bedford, Massachusetts, released its financial outcomes for the quarter ending December 31, 2024, of fiscal year 2025. The annual contract value (ACV) for this quarter stood at $964.9 million, marking a 9.2% rise from the previous year and a 2.5% increase from the previous quarter. news.headline: ASGN to acquire TopBloc, Workday consultancy, for $340 million in cash and equity. Transaction subject to customary closing conditions.
news.summary: ASGN Incorporated, a prominent provider of IT services and professional solutions in commercial and government sectors, has disclosed a significant acquisition. They have entered a definitive agreement to purchase TopBloc, LLC, a top-performing tech-enabled Workday consultancy. The acquisition is valued at $340 million, to be paid in cash and equity. The agreement is pending regulatory approvals, including Hart-Scott Rodino (HSR), and other customary closing conditions. The completion of this transaction is anticipated shortly.

news.summary: In Fremont, California, Ichor Holdings, Ltd. (NASDAQ: ICHR), a company specializing in critical fluid delivery subsystems for semiconductor capital equipment, revealed its financial performance for the fourth quarter and fiscal year 2024. Highlights for the fourth quarter of 2024 include revenues hitting $233 million, aligning with previously provided guidance in November. The gross margin stood at 11.6% on a GAAP basis and 12.0% on a non-GAAP basis. Earnings (loss) were not specifically mentioned in this report.

news.headline: Electronic Arts reports Q3 FY25 results, confident in a return to growth in FY26. CEO mentions success of EA SPORTS FC 25 Team of the Year event.
news.summary: In Redwood City, California, Electronic Arts Inc. (NASDAQ: EA) shared their preliminary financial results for the third quarter ending December 31, 2024. CEO Andrew Wilson highlighted the success of the EA SPORTS FC 25 Team of the Year event, showcasing the teams' adaptability and innovation. The company anticipates a return to growth in FY26 and beyond with confidence, following this record-breaking event.

news.headline: A10 Networks reports Q4 revenue of $74.2 million; 5% increase from 2023. Enterprise revenue up 8%, service provider revenue up 4%.
news.summary: A10 Networks, Inc. disclosed its financial performance for the fourth quarter and full year ending December 31, 2024. The company, a prominent cybersecurity and infrastructure solutions provider, reported a revenue of $74.2 million for Q4 2024, showing a 5% rise from $70.4 million in Q4 2023. Specifically, enterprise revenue saw an 8% increase year-over-year, while service provider revenue grew by 4%. The company trades on the NYSE under the ticker symbol ATEN.

news.headline: SEALSQ invests $20M in startups for quantum computing, QaaS, and AI-driven semiconductor tech, accelerating quantum-safe roadmap.
news.summary: SEALSQ Corp (NASDAQ: LAES) based in Geneva, Switzerland, revealed plans to invest up to $20 million from its cash reserves into cutting-edge startups focusing on quantum computing, Quantum-as-a-Service (QaaS), and AI-driven semiconductor technologies. The initiative is part of the SEALSQ Quantum Roadmap, aimed at facilitating a comprehensive shift towards quantum-safe practices and ensuring adaptability in the changing digital environment. Specializing in Semiconductors, PKI, and Post-Quantum technology hardware and software products, SEALSQ aims to provide the necessary technology, services, and strategic frameworks for a quantum-safe transformation.

news.headline: Nasdaq leads markets, Costco hits new high. Dow Jones and S&P 500 rise. Palantir stands out.
news.summary: On Tuesday, the Nasdaq outperformed other major indexes. Costco achieved a record high and is currently in a favorable buying position. The Dow Jones and S&P 500 also showed gains, but the Nasdaq stood out. Notably, Palantir demonstrated its strength, and Costco broke out into a promising trend.

news.headline: Market inflation bets surge as 10-year breakeven rate hits 16-month high at 2.45%, affecting Fed's rate cut strategy.
news.summary: The U.S. 10-year breakeven inflation rate has reached its highest level since October 2023, at 2.45%. This indicates that investors anticipate annual inflation to average 2.45% over the next decade. The increase in inflation expectations is linked to trade policy uncertainty under the Trump administration, impacting Federal Reserve rate forecasts and bond market positioning. In response to these developments, bondholders are looking at Treasury Inflation-Protected Securities (TIPS) as a superior hedge, offering a 2.06% real yield plus inflation compensation if inflation exceeds the 2.45% average over the next 10 years.

news.headline: Conservancy for Cuyahoga Valley National Park searching for new President and CEO with help from Potrero Group.
news.summary: In Peninsula, Ohio on February 4, 2025, the Board of Directors of the Conservancy for Cuyahoga Valley National Park (Conservancy) has initiated the recruitment process for the new President and CEO. They have engaged Potrero Group, a renowned national strategy and search firm, to oversee the search for the ideal candidate. This move signifies the organization's strategic focus on leadership succession and dedication to finding a qualified individual to steer the Conservancy's future direction.

news.headline: Mattel, Inc. (NASDAQ: MAT) reports strong financial results for Q4 and full year 2024, achieving objectives ahead of expectations.
news.summary: Mattel, Inc. released its financial results for both the fourth quarter and full year of 2024, with Ynon Kreiz, the Chairman and CEO, highlighting the company’s operational success during the year. In the fourth quarter, they experienced growth in their topline. The focus for 2024 was on enhancing profitability, growing gross margin, and generating substantial free cash flow. Mattel successfully achieved all these objectives, surpassing initial expectations. As they move into 2025, which marks their 80th year, the company aims to continue this positive momentum.

news.headline: Key Tronic Corp to expand in Arkansas and Vietnam by 2025, Arkansas by June and Vietnam by Sept, 2025.
news.summary: Arkansas is set to complete its expansion by June 2025, while the expansion in Vietnam is expected to be finished by September 2025. The completion deadlines indicate a significant advancement in infrastructure development in these regions, offering growth opportunities and economic benefits. These expansions will play a crucial role in enhancing the overall infrastructure and capacity, with Arkansas's project aiming to be finalized earlier than Vietnam's. This progress underscores the commitment to improving connectivity and accessibility, ultimately boosting the economic landscape of both areas by the designated timelines.

news.headline: InnovAge reported fiscal Q2 2024 results with total revenue of $209M, a 10.6% increase. Net loss was $13.5M compared to $3.8M in Q2 2023.
news.summary: InnovAge Holding Corp. reported its financial results for the fiscal second quarter ended December 31, 2024. Total revenues were $209.0 million, a 10.6% increase from the same period in 2023, with a net loss of $13.5 million compared to a loss of $3.8 million in 2023. The Center-level Contribution Margin was $37.1 million, up 10.3% from 2023. Adjusted EBITDA was $5.9 million, a decrease of $1.0 million from the previous year. The company had a census of approximately 7,480 participants and ended the quarter with $46.1 million in cash, $40.8 million in short-term investments, and $78.3 million in debt. The company provided financial guidance for the full fiscal year 2025 with a projected revenue range of $815-865 million and Adjusted EBITDA range of $24-31 million. The company will host a conference call to discuss the results further.Overall, InnovAge showed growth in revenue and participant census but experienced an increase in net loss compared to the previous year.

news.headline: Kulicke & Soffa's Q1 2025 results: Net revenue $166.1M, Net income $81.6M, Non-GAAP net income $20.2M. Focus on advanced packaging solutions.
news.summary: Kulicke and Soffa Industries, Inc. reported first quarter financial results for fiscal year 2025, ending December 28, 2024. The company had a net revenue of $166.1 million, with net income of $81.6 million and EPS of $1.51 per fully diluted share. Non-GAAP net income was $20.2 million, with non-GAAP EPS of $0.37 per fully diluted share. There was a significant increase in income from operations and net income compared to the same quarter in the previous year. The company also provided an outlook for the second quarter of fiscal year 2025, with an expected net revenue of approximately $165 million. Kulicke & Soffa focuses on semiconductor and electronics assembly solutions to support various industries and technological advancements.

news.headline: Jack Henry & Associates' Q2 FY2025 saw GAAP revenue up 5.2%, non-GAAP adjusted rev up 6.1%, and GAAP EPS at $1.34. YTD, GAAP revenue increased 5.2% and GAAP operating income by 9.0%, with GAAP EPS at $2.97. Q2's operating expenses rose 5.7%, reaching $450.8M. Net income grew 6.4% with diluted EPS of $1.34. Non-GAAP adjusted revenue reached $573.8M in Q2. CEO mentions 6% non-GAAP revenue growth. Full-year FY2025 guidance indicates GAAP revenue ranging from $2.369B to $2.391B.
news.summary: In the second quarter of fiscal year 2024, financial technology provider Jack Henry & Associates, Inc. reported a 5.2% increase in GAAP revenue and a 3.4% rise in GAAP operating income compared to the same quarter in the previous fiscal year. Non-GAAP adjusted revenue and operating income also saw increases of 6.1% and 7.3% respectively. GAAP EPS was $1.34 per diluted share for the quarter.For the fiscal year-to-date period ending December 31, 2024, GAAP revenue increased by 5.2% and GAAP operating income by 9.0% compared to the prior year. Non-GAAP adjusted revenue and operating income also saw increases of 5.7% and 4.2% respectively. GAAP EPS for the year-to-date period was $2.97 per diluted share.Cash and cash equivalents were $26 million at December 31, 2024, with debt outstanding related to credit facilities at $150 million. The company expects full-year fiscal 2025 revenue to range from $2,369 million to $2,391 million, with an operating margin projection of 23.0% to 23.2% and an EPS guidance of $5.78 to $5.87.Jack Henry & Associates' CEO praised the company's performance in the second quarter, highlighting record sales attainment and a strong sales pipeline. The company's revenue growth was driven by increases in data processing, hosting, card revenue, and payment processing. Operating income, operating expenses, and net income showed positive growth trends as well. Non-GAAP adjustments led to even higher growth rates in various financial metrics.

news.headline: Runway Growth Finance Corp. will announce Q4 & full year 2024 results on March 20, 2025, with conference call at 2:00 p.m. PT.
news.summary: Runway Growth Finance Corp, a top provider of flexible capital solutions to late- and growth-stage companies as an equity-raising alternative, stated it is set to unveil its financial results for Q4 and full year 2024 on March 20, 2025, following the market's close. The company, listed as Nasdaq: RWAY, will host a conference call at 2:00 p.m. PT (5:00 p.m. ET) on the same day to discuss these results.

news.headline: HF Foods Group Inc. (NASDAQ: HFFG) to participate in Oppenheimer Emerging Growth Conference on Feb. 25, 2025, virtually. Executive team to host 1x1 meetings.
news.summary: On February 4, 2025, HF Foods Group Inc. (NASDAQ: HFFG), a top food distributor for Asian restaurants in the US, disclosed their participation in the Oppenheimer Emerging Growth Conference on February 25, 2025. The event will be virtual, with the HF Foods executive team conducting 1x1 meetings with investors. For additional details, interested parties are advised to contact their Oppenheimer representative.

news.headline: Apellis Pharmaceuticals approved equity awards for 3 new employees on Feb 3, 2025, under Nasdaq Listing Rule 5635(c)(4).
news.summary: On February 4, 2025, Apellis Pharmaceuticals, Inc. based in Waltham, Mass., revealed that it has given equity awards to three new employees. The grant date for these awards was February 3, 2025, and they were provided as an inducement for the employees to join the company. These equity awards were granted outside of the 2017 Stock Incentive Plan but fell within the guidelines of the 2020 Inducement Stock Incentive Plan. The decision to grant these awards aligns with Nasdaq Listing Rule 5635(c)(4). Apellis Pharmaceuticals trades on the Nasdaq under the ticker symbol APLS.
